table.style: border: 0px; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

a.title: The logical name of the element
Information about the use of the element
Minimum and Maximum # of times the the element can appear in the instance
Reference to the type of the element

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder : A request to supply a diet, formula feeding (enteral) or oral nutritional supplement to a patient/resident.
This element has or is affected by some invariants

tr.td:
A request for a diet, formula or nutritional supplement
Nutrition Order SHALL contain either Oral Diet , Supplement, or Enteral Formula class

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.patient : The person (patient) who needs the nutrition order for an oral diet, nutritional supplement and/or enteral or formula feeding.
This element is included in summaries

tr.td: The person who requires the diet, formula or nutritional supplement

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.orderer : The practitioner that holds legal responsibility for ordering the diet, nutritional supplement, or formula feedings.
This element is included in summaries

tr.td: Who ordered the diet, formula or nutritional supplement

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.identifier : Identifiers assigned to this order by the order sender or by the order receiver.

tr.td: Identifiers assigned to this order

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.encounter : An encounter that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

tr.td: The encounter associated with that this nutrition order

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.dateTime : The date and time that this nutrition order was requested.
This element is included in summaries

tr.td: Date and time the nutrition order was requested

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.status : The workflow status of the nutrition order/request.
This element is a modifier element
This element is included in summaries

tr.td:
proposed | draft | planned | requested | active | on-hold | completed | cancelled
NutritionOrderStatus ( Required)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.allergyIntolerance : A link to a record of allergies or Intolerances which should be included in the nutrition order.

tr.td: List of the patient's food and nutrition-related allergies and intolerances

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.foodPreferenceModifier : This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food that should be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as Halal, Vegan or Kosher. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.

tr.td:
Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should be given
PatientDiet ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.excludeFoodModifier : This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food that should NOT be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as No Red Meat, No Soy or No Wheat or Gluten-Free. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.

tr.td:
Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should not be given
FoodType ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.oralDiet : Diet given orally in contrast to enteral (tube) feeding.
This element has or is affected by some invariants

tr.td: Oral diet components

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.oralDiet.type : The kind of diet or dietary restriction such as fiber restricted diet or diabetic diet.
This element is included in summaries

tr.td:
Type of oral diet or diet restrictions that describe what can be consumed orally
OralDiet ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.oralDiet.scheduled : The time period and frequency at which the diet should be given.

tr.td: Scheduled frequency of diet

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.oralDiet.nutrient : Class that defines the quantity and type of nutrient modifications required for the oral diet.

tr.td: Required nutrient modifications

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0MaQoY/tMBAACL5MchG8PdPAAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.oralDiet.nutrient.modifier : The nutrient that is being modified such as carbohydrate or sodium.

tr.td:
Type of nutrient that is being modified
NutrientModifier ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.oralDiet.nutrient.amount : The quantity of the specified nutrient to include in diet.

tr.td: Quantity of the specified nutrient

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.oralDiet.texture : Class that describes any texture modifications required for the patient to safely consume various types of solid foods.

tr.td: Required texture modifications

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0MaQoY/tMBAACL5MchG8PdPAAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.oralDiet.texture.modifier : Any texture modifications (for solid foods) that should be made, e.g. easy to chew, chopped, ground, and pureed.

tr.td:
Code to indicate how to alter the texture of the foods, e.g., pureed
TextureModifier ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.oralDiet.texture.foodType : The food type(s) (e.g., meats, all foods) that the texture modification applies to. This could be all foods types.

tr.td:
Concepts that are used to identify an entity that is ingested for nutritional purposes
TextureModifiedFoodType ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.oralDiet.fluidConsistencyType : The required consistency (e.g., honey-thick, nectar-thick, thin, thickened.) of liquids or fluids served to the patient.

tr.td:
The required consistency of fluids and liquids provided to the patient
FluidConsistencyType ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.oralDiet.instruction : Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral diet.

tr.td: Instructions or additional information about the oral diet

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.supplement : Oral nutritional products given in order to add further nutritional value to the patient's diet.
This element has or is affected by some invariants

tr.td: Supplement components

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.supplement.type : The kind of nutritional supplement product required such as a high protein or pediatric clear liquid supplement.
This element is included in summaries

tr.td:
Type of supplement product requested
SupplementType ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.supplement.productName : The product or brand name of the nutritional supplement such as "Acme Protein Shake".

tr.td: Product or brand name of the nutritional supplement

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.supplement.scheduled : The time period and frequency at which the supplement(s) should be given.

tr.td: Scheduled frequency of supplement

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4/x0IaQwY/tMBAACSBMcpuec9bgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: NutritionOrder.supplement.quantity : The amount of the nutritional supplement to be given.

tr.td: Amount of the nutritional supplement

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/zQHDfzoAAJg0xzGxXiQ9AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.supplement.instruction : Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral supplement.

tr.td: Instructions or additional information about the oral supplement

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAD0lEQVR42mP4TwfAQA9LAJ50xzkA9NE0AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula : Feeding provided through the gastrointestinal tract via a tube, catheter, or stoma that delivers nutrition distal to the oral cavity.
This element has or is affected by some invariants

tr.td: Enteral formula components

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/80Bgz/6QAAmETHMRu97hwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.administrationInstructions : Free text formula administration, feeding instructions or additional instructions or information.

tr.td: Formula feeding instructions expressed as text

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/80Bgz/6QAAmETHMRu97hwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.baseFormulaType : The type of enteral or infant formula such as an adult standard formula with fiber or a soy-based infant formula.
This element is included in summaries

tr.td:
Type of enteral or infant formula
EnteralFormulaType ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/80Bgz/6QAAmETHMRu97hwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.baseFormulaProductName : The product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula product such as "ACME Adult Standard Formula".

tr.td: Product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/80Bgz/6QAAmETHMRu97hwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.scheduled : The time period and frequency at which the enteral formula should be delivered to the patient.

tr.td: Scheduled frequency of enteral feeding

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/80Bgz/6QAAmETHMRu97hwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.additiveType : Indicates the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate, fat or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

tr.td:
Type of modular component to add to the feeding
EnteralFormulaAdditiveType ( Example)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/80Bgz/6QAAmETHMRu97hwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.additiveProductName : The product or brand name of the type of modular component to be added to the formula.

tr.td: Product or brand name of the modular additive

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/80Bgz/6QAAmETHMRu97hwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.caloricDensity : The amount of energy (Calories) that the formula should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz. For example, an infant may require a formula the provides 24 Calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that provides 1.5 Calorie/mL.

tr.td: Amount of energy per specified volume that is required

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/80Bgz/6QAAmETHMRu97hwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.routeofAdministration : The route or physiological path of administration into the patient 's gastrointestinal tract for purposes of providing the formula feeding, e.g., nasogastric tube.

tr.td:
How the formula should enter the patient's gastrointestinal tract
EnteralRouteOfAdministration ( Required)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/80Bgz/6QAAmETHMRu97hwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.quantity : The volume of formula to provide to the patient per the specified administration schedule.

tr.td: The volume of formula to provide

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/80Bgz/6QAAmETHMRu97hwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.rate : The rate of administration of formula via a feeding pump, e.g., 60 mL per hour, according to the specified schedule.

tr.td: Speed with which the formula is provided per period of time

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/80Bgz/6QAAmETHMRu97hwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.rateAdjustment : The change in the rate of administration over a given time, e.g. increase by 10 mL/hour every 4 hours.

tr.td: Change in the rate of administration over a given time

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAyAAAAACAQAAAACIh4VlAAAAD0lEQVR42mP4TwfAQA9LAJ50xzkA9NE0AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: NutritionOrder.enteralFormula.maxVolumeToDeliver : The maximum total quantity of formula that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g., 1440 mL over 24 hours.

tr.td: Upper limit on formula volume per unit of time

description.value: Base StructureDefinition for NutritionOrder Resource

short.value: A request for a diet, formula or nutritional supplement

definition.value: A request to supply a diet, formula feeding (enteral) or oral nutritional supplement to a patient/resident.

comments.value: Referenced by an Order Request (workflow).

human.value: Nutrition Order SHALL contain either Oral Diet , Supplement, or Enteral Formula class

short.value: Logical id of this artefact

definition.value: The logical id of the resource, as used in the url for the resoure. Once assigned, this value never changes.

comments.value: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

short.value: Metadata about the resource

definition.value: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

short.value: A set of rules under which this content was created

definition.value: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.

comments.value: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

short.value: Language of the resource content

definition.value: The base language in which the resource is written.

comments.value:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource
Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

description.value: A human language

short.value: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

definition.value: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

comments.value: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

short.value: Contained, inline Resources

definition.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

comments.value: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: The person who requires the diet, formula or nutritional supplement

definition.value: The person (patient) who needs the nutrition order for an oral diet, nutritional supplement and/or enteral or formula feeding.

short.value: Who ordered the diet, formula or nutritional supplement

definition.value: The practitioner that holds legal responsibility for ordering the diet, nutritional supplement, or formula feedings.

short.value: Identifiers assigned to this order

definition.value: Identifiers assigned to this order by the order sender or by the order receiver.

short.value: The encounter associated with that this nutrition order

definition.value: An encounter that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

short.value: Date and time the nutrition order was requested

definition.value: The date and time that this nutrition order was requested.

short.value: proposed | draft | planned | requested | active | on-hold | completed | cancelled

definition.value: The workflow status of the nutrition order/request.

comments.value: Typically the system placing the order sets the status to requested. There after, the order is maintained by the receiver that updates the status as the request is handled.

description.value: Codes specifying the state of the request. Describes the lifecycle of the nutrition order.

short.value: List of the patient's food and nutrition-related allergies and intolerances

definition.value: A link to a record of allergies or Intolerances which should be included in the nutrition order.

comments.value: Information on a patient's food allergies and intolerances, inform healthcare personnel about the type of foods that the patient should receive or consume.

short.value: Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should be given

definition.value: This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food that should be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as Halal, Vegan or Kosher. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.

comments.value: Information on a patient's food preferences inform healthcare personnel about the food that the patient should receive or consume.

description.value: Medical, cultural or ethical food preferences to help with catering requirements

short.value: Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should not be given

definition.value: This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food that should NOT be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as No Red Meat, No Soy or No Wheat or Gluten-Free. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.

comments.value: Information on a patient's food allergies and intolerances, and preferences inform healthcare personnel about the type of foods that the patient should receive or consume.

description.value: Codes used to indicate the type of food that should NOT be given to the patient.

short.value: Oral diet components

definition.value: Diet given orally in contrast to enteral (tube) feeding.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

short.value: Type of oral diet or diet restrictions that describe what can be consumed orally

definition.value: The kind of diet or dietary restriction such as fiber restricted diet or diabetic diet.

description.value: Codes used to indicate the type of diet being ordered for a patient.

short.value: Scheduled frequency of diet

definition.value: The time period and frequency at which the diet should be given.

short.value: Required nutrient modifications

definition.value: Class that defines the quantity and type of nutrient modifications required for the oral diet.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. short.value: Type of nutrient that is being modified

definition.value: The nutrient that is being modified such as carbohydrate or sodium.

description.value: Codes for types of nutrient that is being modified such as carbohydrate or sodium.

short.value: Quantity of the specified nutrient

definition.value: The quantity of the specified nutrient to include in diet.

short.value: Required texture modifications

definition.value: Class that describes any texture modifications required for the patient to safely consume various types of solid foods.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. short.value: Code to indicate how to alter the texture of the foods, e.g., pureed

definition.value: Any texture modifications (for solid foods) that should be made, e.g. easy to chew, chopped, ground, and pureed.

comments.value: Coupled with the foodType (Meat).

description.value: Codes for food consistency types or texture modifications to apply to foods.

short.value: Concepts that are used to identify an entity that is ingested for nutritional purposes

definition.value: The food type(s) (e.g., meats, all foods) that the texture modification applies to. This could be all foods types.

comments.value: Coupled with the textureModifier; could be (All Foods).

description.value: Codes for types of foods that are texture modified.

short.value: The required consistency of fluids and liquids provided to the patient

definition.value: The required consistency (e.g., honey-thick, nectar-thick, thin, thickened.) of liquids or fluids served to the patient.

description.value: Codes used to represent the consistency of fluids and liquids provided to the patient.

short.value: Instructions or additional information about the oral diet

definition.value: Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral diet.

comments.value: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

short.value: Supplement components

definition.value: Oral nutritional products given in order to add further nutritional value to the patient's diet.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. short.value: Type of supplement product requested

definition.value: The kind of nutritional supplement product required such as a high protein or pediatric clear liquid supplement.

description.value: Codes for nutritional supplements to be provided to the patient

short.value: Product or brand name of the nutritional supplement

definition.value: The product or brand name of the nutritional supplement such as "Acme Protein Shake".

short.value: Scheduled frequency of supplement

definition.value: The time period and frequency at which the supplement(s) should be given.

short.value: Amount of the nutritional supplement

definition.value: The amount of the nutritional supplement to be given.

short.value: Instructions or additional information about the oral supplement

definition.value: Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral supplement.

comments.value: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

short.value: Enteral formula components

definition.value: Feeding provided through the gastrointestinal tract via a tube, catheter, or stoma that delivers nutrition distal to the oral cavity.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. short.value: Formula feeding instructions expressed as text

definition.value: Free text formula administration, feeding instructions or additional instructions or information.

comments.value: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

short.value: Type of enteral or infant formula

definition.value: The type of enteral or infant formula such as an adult standard formula with fiber or a soy-based infant formula.

description.value: Codes for type of enteral formula to be administered to patient.

short.value: Product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula

definition.value: The product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula product such as "ACME Adult Standard Formula".

short.value: Scheduled frequency of enteral feeding

definition.value: The time period and frequency at which the enteral formula should be delivered to the patient.

short.value: Type of modular component to add to the feeding

definition.value: Indicates the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate, fat or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

description.value: Codes for the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

map.value: N/A (not differentiated from NutritionalFormulaType in V3)

short.value: Product or brand name of the modular additive

definition.value: The product or brand name of the type of modular component to be added to the formula.

short.value: Amount of energy per specified volume that is required

definition.value: The amount of energy (Calories) that the formula should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz. For example, an infant may require a formula the provides 24 Calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that provides 1.5 Calorie/mL.

short.value: How the formula should enter the patient's gastrointestinal tract

definition.value: The route or physiological path of administration into the patient 's gastrointestinal tract for purposes of providing the formula feeding, e.g., nasogastric tube.

description.value: Codes specifying the route of administration of enteral formula.

short.value: The volume of formula to provide

definition.value: The volume of formula to provide to the patient per the specified administration schedule.

short.value: Speed with which the formula is provided per period of time

definition.value: The rate of administration of formula via a feeding pump, e.g., 60 mL per hour, according to the specified schedule.

short.value: Change in the rate of administration over a given time

definition.value: The change in the rate of administration over a given time, e.g. increase by 10 mL/hour every 4 hours.

short.value: Upper limit on formula volume per unit of time

definition.value: The maximum total quantity of formula that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g., 1440 mL over 24 hours.

definition.value: A request to supply a diet, formula feeding (enteral) or oral nutritional supplement to a patient/resident.

definition.value: Indicates the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate, fat or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

definition.value: The product or brand name of the type of modular component to be added to the formula.

definition.value: The amount of energy (Calories) that the formula should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz. For example, an infant may require a formula the provides 24 Calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that provides 1.5 Calorie/mL.
